title: Thesis on film titles
content:
Hi,

I am a graphic design student and have just started writing a thesis for my Bachelor Degree, about film title design and its relationship to film, and about the effects of the title design on the audience and their perception of a film. I was just wondering if anyone hade any tips on authors or books on this subject? Or maybe you have any other suggestions as to where I might find valuable information?

Thanks,

Lisa

ps. hope I have posted this in the right place - I'm new here, so sorry if not.
author: lisa maria matilda

comments.content: Have you come across both [The Art of the Title](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.artofthetitle.com/) and [Forget the Film, Watch the Titles](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.watchthetitles.com/)?

I was about to say [The Art of the Title](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.artofthetitle.com/%20/2008/12/saul-bass-on-titles-documentary/) but auricfuzz already mention it...  
I also recomend [Saul Bass on Titles: Documentary](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.titledesignproject.com/2008/12/saul-bass-on-titles-documentary/). The [site](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.titledesignproject.com/) as also lots of info about titles...

António

...and also:

[A History of Movie Posters](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.reelclassics.com/Articles/General/posters-article.htm)  
 [The Art of the Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.moviemaker.com/directing/article/the_art_of_the_poster_2949/)  
 [30 amazing vintage movie posters](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.designer-daily.com/30-amazing-vintage-movie-posters-4818)  
 [Quick Cuts, Coarse Letters, Multiple Screens](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/www.typotheque.com/site/article.php?id=48), this last one very interesting about film title design and its relationship to film.

António

...and finaly  
 [Film and television title designers wiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Film_and_television_title_designers).

António
Yves Peters writes quite frequently about film graphics, poster and title sequences on the fontfeed.com

Thanks a lot everyone! I have visited some of the sites mentioned, but some are completely new to me (there seems to be many interesting articles on typotheque.com for example. And I didn't know about the Saul Bass documentary, I have to check that out). Thanks again, and if you happen to come up with any more tips and advices I would gladly take them.

Lisa

The FontFeed blog (by FontShop) has a weekly roundup called ScreenFonts, disecting the typography and overall design of posters of newly released movies:

[http://fontfeed.com/archives/tag/movie-posters/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017170558/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/tag/movie-posters/ "http://fontfeed.com/archives/tag/movie-posters/")
